events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on a rainy afternoon resulting in front-end vehicle damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial accident description and vehicle involved.
Assigned an insurance agent specialized in vehicle collision claims to assist the customer further.
Acknowledged receipt of the car accident claim and informed the customer about the next steps.
Requested police report, vehicle damage photos, and repair estimates to process the auto accident claim.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the police report and detailed photos of the collision damage.
Investigation began to verify details of the collision, assess fault, and review submitted documents.
Investigation findings confirmed the claim legitimacy and established the extent of the vehicle damage.
Proposed a fair settlement offer based on repair costs and market value of the vehicle before the accident.
Customer provided positive feedback and accepted the settlement offer for the vehicle damage claim.
Approved the claim officially after customer acceptance and final review of all documentation.
Issued payment to the customer to cover the vehicle repair costs as per the approved settlement.
Closed the auto accident claim successfully after payment disbursal and confirmation from the customer.
Archived all electronic and physical records pertaining to the car collision claim as per policy.
